results.title: Harmony in music
results.brief_description: Elementary students in a school ensemble and in a chorus learn how harmony enriches music. The music leader demonstrates the relationship of harmony to chords, explains how chords are built, and how harmony enhances melody and rhythm. The principles of harmony and chords are demonstrated on an actual piano keyboard, with charts, with instruments and with group singing.

results.title: Harmonie
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Dorothy Rosenberg and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A gentle blend of music, people and nature; a summer camp where melodies ripple off the waves and rhythms bounce out of the shadows. Every Summer since 1953, CAMMAC (Canadian Amateur Musicians/Musiciens Amateurs du Canada) has held a bilingual Music camp in Quebec’s Laurentian Mountains. Here, people of all ages and levels of Musical ability come together to learn and make music with a professional staff of Canadian and international musicians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Dorothy Rosenberg and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Harlow New Town
results.brief_description: In a visit to Harlow, one of britain’s new “satellite” towns, Christopher Chataway discusses this modern building experiment with Frederick Gibberd, Harlow’s architect-planner, and interviews a number of people living and working in the town.

results.title: The Hard core
results.creator_credit: Arthur Zegart and International Refugee Organization. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: Film deals with the “hard core” on intellectuals and invalid war victims remaining in the displaced persons’ camps in Europe and shows the steps already taken by the International Refugee Organisation to alleviate the suffering of these special groups and try to find homes for them in other countries.

results.title: Growth of infant behaviour: Early stages
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: The activities and responses of an infant seated in a small chair in a photographic dome are recorded. Simultaneous side-by-side projection gives a comparisons of the same infant at different ages.

results.title: Growing old
results.brief_description: The problems presented by an aging population, illustrated by real-life case histories. The contribution of the welfare and medical services throughout Britain to the geriatric problem is emphasised, and the film touches on all facets of life among the elderly, including family relationships, economic factors and health.

results.title: Green pea harvest prediction
results.brief_description: Describes the system of predicting the actual day on which to pick peas to get the maximum harvest from the crop. Samples are taken periodically to obtain indications of maturity which increases at the rate of twenty units pf measurement per day.

results.title: The Green machine
results.brief_description: The Green Machine is the Australian Army, and, to the accompaniment of Tchaikovsky’s 1812 Overture, we see depicted every aspect of life in the Australian Army of 1976.

results.title: The Greatest game on earth
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Roland Beckett, Australian National Football Council and Melbourne Repertory Film Unit
results.brief_description: Ricky, who has recently arrived in Australia, sees his first game of Australian Rules Football when he follows the boys of his neighbourhood to the Melbourne Cricket Ground where Geelong is playing Collingwood. At first the atmosphere is strange and new, but the boy soon becomes a part of the enthusiastic crowd excited by the fast field play, high punt kicks, snap shots for goal and clever manoeuvres which comprise Australia’s national sport.
